ThingDef.label: red bugloss
ThingDef.description: One of the weirdest plants from Earth, genetically modified to thrive in wet, warm environments. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: gomphoeria
ThingDef.description: An unusually tall plant with bright, pink nodules. Its nodules are slightly toxic for humans, and it produces a strange, rotten fruit smell, so it is considered absolutely inedible. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: aaklac
ThingDef.description: A rare, huge flower which can be found in the deepest jungles. Its quite striking colour and nice smell makes it popular in gardening, if it can be extracted from the deep jungle, of course. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: deep jungle tree
ThingDef.description: This jungle tree is not of terrestrial origins, originating from the deepest crevices of an alien jungle. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: giant stikehr
ThingDef.description: A giant alien mushroom that glows in the strange darkening mist. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: giant septimum
ThingDef.description: This Septimum plant has grown to an enormous size, with a flowering top as large as a person. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: glowing grass
ThingDef.description: Wild grass. Grows anywhere there is a little light and minimally fertile ground. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: wild radagast
ThingDef.description: This twisting alien plant grows small glowing berries. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: giant gamma
ThingDef.description: Like many other flora from the Forsakens native planet, this huge globular plant is bioluminescent. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: tangle tea
ThingDef.description: This strange plant seems to be of alien origins. It doesn't seem to be fit for human consumption. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: euphorbia rimworldia
ThingDef.description: A plant of the euphorbia genus, commonly called spurges. This plant has adapted to arid climates and stores a lot of water inside their spine-covered leaves. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: dead bower tree
ThingDef.description: Despite its common name, the dead bower tree is not truly dead, just exceptionally adapted to survival in arid weather. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: slimecasia
ThingDef.description: Although at first sight this seems to be an independent plant, its roots are intricately interconnected with the rest of the gelatinous superorganism. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: slimy fern
ThingDef.description: Although at first sight this seems to be an independent plant, its roots are intricately interconnected with the rest of the gelatinous superorganism. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: tall slimy grass
ThingDef.description: Wild tall grass. Slows down anyone moving over it. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: slimy tree
ThingDef.description: This tree doesn't seem to be entirely solid. Upon further examination, it isn't an independent entity, its roots fusing seamlessly with the hardened gelatinous ground. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: large slimy tree
ThingDef.description: This tree doesn't seem to be entirely solid. Upon further examination, it isn't an independent entity, its roots fusing seamlessly with the hardened gelatinous ground. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: exotic flowers
ThingDef.description: A bunch of colourful flowers. These are fake.

ThingDef.label: gargantuan lithops
ThingDef.description: Lithops is a genus of succulent plants often known as pebble plants or living stones, due to their stone-like appearance that allows them to avoid being eaten by blending in with surrounding rocks. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: giant mutant hibiscus
ThingDef.description: Giant flowers genetically modified by a long-forgotten genetics company using the genome of a hibiscus plant. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: giant sunflower.
ThingDef.description: Giant flowers genetically modified by a long-forgotten genetics company using the genome of the common sunflower plant. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: giant tulips
ThingDef.description: Giant flowers genetically modified by a long-forgotten genetics company using the genome of a tulip plant. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: sessile mechanoid tree
ThingDef.description: This thing was once a tree. Mechanoids repurposed its cells into a half-tree, half-mechanoid abomination, serving an unknown purpose. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: hardy grass
ThingDef.description: Wild grass. Grows anywhere there is a little light and minimally fertile ground. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: mangrove tree
ThingDef.description: A tree that grows in saline or brackish water. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: parasitic mangrove
ThingDef.description: A weird, colourful plant adapted to extract nutrients from mangrove trees. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: mangrove palm
ThingDef.description: A palm tree adapted to the mangrove conditions. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: lilac beacon
ThingDef.description: The lilac beacon is a tall mushroom with a bright purple cap. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: witches' oyster
ThingDef.description: A small, ramified fungal colony with a pungent aroma. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: agaricus domecap
ThingDef.description: Everything about this fungus screams "I'm toxic, stay away from me". This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: giant agarilux
ThingDef.description: A colossal purple mushroom. Its size and glowing protrusions make this fungus beautiful to look at. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: arbuscular mycorrhiza
ThingDef.description: A mycorrhiza is a symbiotic association between a fungus and a plant. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: dribbling cap
ThingDef.description: A huge pink mushroom, constantly dribbling a pungent, resin-like substance. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: recurved stropharia
ThingDef.description: A big greyish mushroom. Its size and glowing protrusions make this fungus beautiful to look at. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: slimy pholiota
ThingDef.description: A blueish-pink mushroom, secreting a slimy substance that attracts insects. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: Agarilux Prime
ThingDef.description: An unbelievably large exemplar of Agarilux. This myconic colony has adapted perfectly to its environment. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: ocular grass
ThingDef.description: This grass is completely alien, probably not even 100% carbon based. Not very edible for terrestrial creatures. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: ocular plant
ThingDef.description: This grass is completely alien, probably not even 100% carbon based. Not very edible for terrestrial creatures. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: ocular plant
ThingDef.description: This grass is completely alien, probably not even 100% carbon based. Not very edible for terrestrial creatures. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: ocular tree
ThingDef.description: This tree is completely alien, probably not even 100% carbon based, and it seems to be struggling to grow from exposure to a terrestrial environment. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: half transformed ocular tree
ThingDef.description: A strange infection seems to be transforming this regular oak into an ocular tree. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: tentacular aberration
ThingDef.description: This plant is completely alien. The blue nodules at the end of each branch / tentacle produce an eerie rattling sound from time to time. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: globular aberration
ThingDef.description: A sickly pink orb supported by a network of gnarled branches. A reddish sap constantly drips from its wood, and seems to keep insects at bay. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: blood bouquet
ThingDef.description: A spiny plant with some kind of fruit hanging from its top. The fruit seems to be as hard as the trunk itself, and equally covered in spines. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: crystal horn
ThingDef.description: This strange flower seems to be only partially organic. Part of its structure is clearly crystalline, and it appears to be unaffected, or even bolstered, by the extremely cold climate. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: frost leaf
ThingDef.description: These translucent plants seem to be able to grow almost anywhere, even in some snow covered areas. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: rime nodules
ThingDef.description: A very strange plant, partly inorganic, that seems to extract propane from the surrounding landscape and store it as an energy source in rime-bound chemical sacs. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: crystal flower
ThingDef.description: A tall, translucent flower that seems to be partially inorganic. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: flash frozen tree
ThingDef.description: This tree, which probably started growing in a rare period of summer heat, has been frozen in place by the extreme temperatures, its leaves crystallized by the toxic propane compounds. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: brown barrel cactus
ThingDef.description: The brown barrel cactus, Ferocactus Brunetus, is an extremophile plant that thrives in low-water and poor sunlight conditions. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: tinkle grass
ThingDef.description: Wild grass. Grows anywhere there is a little light and minimally fertile ground. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: firevine tree
ThingDef.description: Firevine trees are pyrophitic plants that are able to survive wildfires due to a clever layer of thermal insulation provided by their fire retardant bark. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: green rock fern
ThingDef.description: A wild tall fern. Slows down anyone moving over it. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: iashiphus
ThingDef.description: This vivid green plant seem to be related to cacti. Though it's fleshy bark is not edible, it produces flowers than can be consumed by humans. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: sugar famewort
ThingDef.description: The sugar famewort grows in areas with a high concentration of pollinating insects. It generates a sweet nectar that attracts these insects, and they disperse its pollen when they feed on it. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: raven nettle
ThingDef.description: Tangled, thorny, woody shoots covered with leaves. Raven nettle grows in clusters, and slows down anyone moving over it. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: dried raven nettle
ThingDef.description: Tangled, thorny, woody shoots covered with leaves. Raven nettle grows in clusters, and slows down anyone moving over it. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: fan palm
ThingDef.description: This exuberant palm grows in areas with a rich soil surrounding the tar pits. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: keening cordax
ThingDef.description: The keening cordax is a carnivore plant so called for the high-pitched sound that it makes during the day. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: toxic gamma
ThingDef.description: A huge bioluminescent globular plant. Can be used as a natural sunlamp to grow regular plants, though the toxic environment it grows at might not be the best for cultivation. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: polluted stikehr
ThingDef.description: A giant alien mushroom that glows in the strange darkening mist. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: deep jungle polux
ThingDef.description: This jungle polux tree has adapted so perfectly to polluted soil and airborne toxins that it doesn't even need to remove pollution from its environment. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: weeping toxberry
ThingDef.description: A short toxin-adapted shrub with berries so unbelievably toxic that no animal would ever dare consume them. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: toxibulb
ThingDef.description: This slimy bulb seems to be feeding on the polluted terrain like a parasite. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: euphorbia desiccata
ThingDef.description: A plant of the euphorbia genus, commonly called spurges. This plant is a variety of the Euphorbia Rimworldia plant that has adapted to polluted environments. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: toxi grass
ThingDef.description: Wild grass. Grows anywhere there is a little light and minimally fertile ground. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: giant toxic flower
ThingDef.description: A continously blooming giant flower with a dangerous, bright pink colour. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: agaritox
ThingDef.description: A giant mushroom that has adapted to growing in extremely polluted environments. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: amethyst land coral fungus
ThingDef.description: A very strange purple coloured fungus that resembles a coral. Grows only in polluted soil. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: flowering ocular grass
ThingDef.description: Are those... eyes?

ThingDef.label: mutated ocular tree
ThingDef.description: This ocular tree has been affected by pollution and mutated in strange ways. This one is fake.

ThingDef.label: polluted globular aberration
ThingDef.description: This globular aberration has been affected by pollution and mutated in strange ways. This one is fake.
